roleset.name: sell at auction
roleset.note: AUCTION_OFF-V NOTES: Frames file for 'auction' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. (from auction.01-v predicate notes)
AUCTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry auction.01, OntoNotes grouping auction-n senses 1& 3; maps to VN class price-54.4. Framed by Claire. (from auction.01-n)

roles.note: highest bidder/buyer will definitely occur at some point; I'm not sureabout price and benefactive though. (from auction.01-v) As with verb frame, beneficiary arg seems unlikely. (from auction.01-n)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Indeed. Recently, [the trust]-1 failed *trace*-1 to auction off the paper mill, a bank, an office building and a small cotton-ginning plant.
example.arg: the paper mill, a bank, an office building and a small cotton-ginning plant

example.name: Arg0 and TMP
example.text: Mr. Payson , an art dealer and collector , sold Vincent van Gogh's `` Irises '' at a Sotheby 's auction in November 1987 toAustralian businessman Alan Bond .

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: Sotheby 's auction of the Linda and Gerald Guterman collection inNew York
example.arg: of the Linda and Gerald Guterman collection in New York

example.name: Arg0 and TMP
example.text: Their firm buys government notes at the monthly auction of the Treasury Department.

example.name: Arg 1 & 3
example.text: A recent example is the auction of a cheese sandwich for thousands of dollars because it contained a supposed likeness of the Virgin Mary.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: But in 1991, when the government of Orissa proposed a leasing policy that would have resulted in the auction of leases to the highest bidder...

roleset.note: AUCTION-V NOTES: VerbNet class price-54.4. (from auction.02-v)

roles.note: highest bidder/buyer will definitely occur at some point; I'm not sureabout price and benefactive though. (from auction.02-v)
